source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Awn 2 mm long or less, not conspicuously protruding beyond glumes
Awn more than 2 mm long, clearly protruding beyond glumes
Spikelets (excluding awns) less than 4 mm long; margins of glumes and lemmas commonly free to base; anthers 0.7–1.8 mm long; culm often decumbent at base and rooting at lower nodes
Spikelets (excluding awns) 4–6 mm long; margins of glumes and lemmas connate above base; anthers 2–4 mm long; culms erect, not rooting at nodes
Glumes conspicuously hairy on keels and sides (hairs of keel >1 mm long), united up to 30% of their length from base
Glumes almost glabrous (hairs confined to keel and then sparse and to c. 0.5 mm long), united for up to 50% of their length from base. See note under genus description.
